questions.questionText: What color would the sky be if you were standing on the moon with the sun shining upon you?
The word "astrophysics" comes from a combination of Greek words. Are you aware of which of these bodies "Astro" refers to?
What is the solar system"s first planet from the sun?
In our solar system, how many stars are there?
What is the name of the planet that is sometimes referred to as Earth"s sister planet?
What is the frequency of a lunar eclipse?
I"m sore from all of these people constantly moving around on me.
How many of our solar system"s planets are formed of gas?
What is the name of the planet that is nearest to the sun?
What is the name of the planet that is closest to the Sun?
Imagine we"ve arrived at the next planet, VENUS. In visible light, we can"t view the surface of Venus from space. Why?
options: Venus is covered with a thick layer of clouds
Mercury is covered with a thick layer of clouds
mars is covered with a thick layer of clouds

questions.questionText: Which planet is referred to as “The Red Planet”?

How long does it take the moon to complete one orbit around the Earth?
Although I used to be a planet, I am no longer one. Who am I?

What is the name of the planet that orbits the Sun?
Which of these was once recognized as a planet but was changed to a dwarf planet in 2006?
Which planet is famous for its large red spot?
I"m a large gas giant, but to equal the size of the sun, you"d have to put 900 of me together. I appear to be wearing pajamas with a large red spot on them. What planet am I?
What direction does the sunrise from?
Although I am not the largest planet, my ring system is by far the largest and, dare I say, most gorgeous. Who am I?
Pluto was no longer considered a planet in 2006. How many planets are currently known to exist in our solar system?
What is the name of the planet that is third from the Sun?
What is the maximum temperature that Venus" surface can reach in degrees Fahrenheit?

Which of our solar system"s planets is the second largest?

In the Andromeda Galaxy, how many stars are there?
